it.unibo.alchemist.model.interfaces

Interface INeighborhood<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type which describes the concentration of a molecule Interface for a neighborhood. When implementing it in a real class, please remember to correctly implement also the equals method inherited from Object.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Iterable<INode<T>>, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Neighborhood

    public interface INeighborhood<T>
extends Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<INode<T>>

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addNeighbor

        void addNeighbor(INode<T> neigh)
        Allows to add a node to the neighborhood. Please note that changing neighborhoods directly DOES NOT GUARANTEE this modification to be propagated through the environment.
        Parameters:
        neigh - the node to add

      • clone

        INeighborhood<T> clone()
                throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Returns:
        A new Neighborhood, which has a CLONED list of neighbors, but POINTS TO and DOES NOT CLONE the whole environment and the center node, neither the nodes contained in the neighbors list.
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException - Never thrown. Only for compatibility with the cumbersome Object.clone().

      • contains

        boolean contains(INode<T> n)
        Verifies if a node is contained inside a neighborhood.
        Parameters:
        n - the node to be searched
        Returns:
        true if n belongs to this neighborhood

      • contains

        boolean contains(int n)
        Verifies if a node with the specified id is contained inside a neighborhood.
        Parameters:
        n - the node id to be searched
        Returns:
        true if n belongs to this neighborhood

      • getBetweenRange

        Set<? extends INode<T>> getBetweenRange(double min,
                                        double max)
        Allows to get all the nodes in this neighborhood whose distance from the center node is between min and max.
        Parameters:
        min - if a node has a distance from the center node lower than min, it will be not in the returned list
        max - if a node has a distance from the center node higher than max, it will be not in the returned list
        Returns:
        the list of nodes whose distance from the center node is between min and max.

      • getCenter

        INode<T> getCenter()
        Allows to access the central node.
        Returns:
        the central node, namely the node whose neighbors are represented by this structure.

      • getNeighborById

        INode<T> getNeighborById(int id)
        Parameters:
        id - the node id
        Returns:
        the nodes

      • getNeighborByNumber

        INode<T> getNeighborByNumber(int num)
        Returns the num-th neighbor.
        Parameters:
        num - the neighbor index
        Returns:
        the num-th neighbor

      • getNeighbors

        Collection<? extends INode<T>> getNeighbors()
        Allows to directly access every node in the neighborhood. A change of this List will be reflected in the neighborhood.
        Returns:
        the list of the neighbors

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if this neighborhood has no neighbors

      • removeNeighbor

        void removeNeighbor(INode<T> neighbor)
        Parameters:
        neighbor - removes a neighbor from the neighborhood

      • size

        int size()
        Returns:
        the number of neighbors.
